business.headline: Borge Brende steps down as president and CEO of World Economic Forum after Epstein revelationsBorge Brende steps down as president and CEO of World Economic Forum after Epstein revelations
Sensex and Nifty erase early gains to end flat over global uncertaintyThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 27.46 points to close at 82,248.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 14.05 points to end at 25,496.55.

MeitY Secretary S Krishnan says social media must work within constitutional limitsS Krishnan defended the government's approach to regulating digital platforms. He said the Ministry's actions are firmly rooted in the Constitution and follow due legal process.

Gold jumped 72% and silver soared 122% last year. Can 2026 deliver the same rally?Gold and silver may not climb the way they did in 2025, but the base remains firm. This year calls for clear judgement, realistic expectations and a focus on long-term signals.

Government mandates 20% ethanol-blended petrol with RON 95 from April 1In a notification issued on February 17, the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas directed oil marketing companies to supply ethanol-blended petrol, also called E20 petrol, across all states and Union Territories.

8th Pay Commission progresses: Salary hikes and retirement benefits in focusAmong the main demands are a higher fitment factor, bigger annual increments, improved retirement benefits and changes in pension and promotion policies.

Gold dips, silver slips: Should you buy now?After recent gains, gold and silver prices have slipped marginally. While the fall is small, many buyers and investors are now wondering if this correction offers a chance to buy.

The Rs 1 crore question: Should you invest in stocks or buy a home?For India's middle class, owning a home is not just a financial goal. It is security. It is respect. It is stability for the family. Many parents believe a rented house means uncertainty, while a home of your own means safety.

Property deals under Rs 20 lakh? PAN may not be needed from April 1At present, PAN must be quoted when buying or selling immovable property, such as a house, flat, or plot, if the transaction value exceeds Rs 10 lakh.

Deepinder Goyal wins EY Entrepreneur Of The Year 2025 awardDeepinder Goyal was recognised for his focus on innovation, strong operations and long-term thinking. The jury also noted that his businesses have created thousands of jobs for youth and gig workers and supported a wider ecosystem of entrepreneurs across the country.

Love swiping your credit card? Here's how to use it without falling into a debt trapMore Indians are now swiping their credit cards, though most have not learned the habits needed to stay out of debt. This article shows the mistakes people make and the simple habits that help.
Sensex, Nifty open higher buoyed by IT stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 53.27 points to 82,329.34, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 33.90 points to 25,516.40 as of 9:35 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Will stock market rise or fall today?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,676 at 8:00 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 may open above Wednesday's closing level of 25,482.5. The early signal points to a mild positive start for the day.

8th Pay Commission website: What's inside and how employees can share viewsWith the launch of the 8th Pay Commission portal, central government employees can now track updates, explore past pay recommendations, and share their suggestions. Have you checked the website yet?

Destroyed my life: Indian CEO sells firm, quits Sweden, blames xenophobiaWhat was meant to be a startup success story in Sweden has ended in an anguished exit for Indian entrepreneur Abhijith Nag Balasubramanyam. Ten months after founding a company, he has been forced to sell his business and return to India. What's behind the move? What challenges did he face? Read on to find out.
Sensex, Nifty erase early gains to end marginally higher; RIL down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 50.15 points to close at 82,276.07, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 57.85 points to end at 25,482.50.

Why your Rs 1.2 lakh salary still feels tight even with just Rs 55,000 EMIsWith a Rs 1.2 lakh monthly income and Rs 55,000 in EMIs, you would expect to have enough left for savings and comfort. But many people still feel financially stretched. Are hidden fixed expenses quietly consuming your income?

With AI hurting IT sector, what's the smarter bet: Stocks or IT mutual funds?While AI fears have driven the sharp fall in IT stocks, the correction has also reset valuations, prompting some long-term investors to see a potential entry opportunity.

No more hidden charges? RBI orders banks to remove misleading app tricksThe RBI's move aims to ensure customers are not misled into buying products or paying charges without proper awareness. Banks will also be barred from bundling financial products together without clear approval from the customer.

Gold crosses Rs 1.61 lakh, silver nears Rs 2.7 lakh in fresh rally: Should you buy?Precious metals are back in focus as gold climbs above Rs 1.61 lakh and silver approaches Rs 2.7 lakh. The steady rise has sparked fresh interest among investors, raising the key question, i.e., is this the right time to buy?

entertainment.headline: Rashmika-Vijay's wedding pics out? Here's the truth behind viral photos Photos of Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna have surfaced online, sparking speculation among fans that they are from the couple's wedding. However, with the duo yet to release any official pictures, fans continue to wait for confirmation from their team.

Infuriating: Ileana D'Cruz slams trolls for body-shaming Rihanna after childbirth Ileana D'Cruz has spoken out against the online criticism directed at Rihanna for her post-pregnancy body, highlighting the unrealistic expectations placed on women to 'bounce back' after childbirth.
Korean filmmaker Park Chan-wook to head Cannes main competition jury South Korean filmmaker Park Chan-wook will preside over the Feature Film Jury at the 79th Cannes Film Featival.

Actor Aishwarya among 11 arrested in kidnap and assault of film director Anish Actor Aishwarya was among 11 accused arrested in the kidnap and assault of director Anish. The police have said that the ongoing investigation will uncover the full conspiracy.

Vijay and Rashmika's teams distribute sweets to media after wedding in Udaipur Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna's team distributed sweets to the media and people outside Udaipur's ITC Momentos. The couple got married as per Telugu rituals on Thursday morning.

A big win for Indian cinema: Ritesh Sidhwani on Boong's BAFTA triumph Producer Ritesh Sidhwani said that the BAFTA win of Manipuri film Boong marked a historic moment for Indian cinema. The film recently won Best Children's and Family Film at the 79th British Academy Film Awards.

High Court pauses The Kerala Story 2 release, says censors didn't abide by rules The Kerala High Court stayed the release of The Kerala Story 2 a day before its scheduled theatrical debut. Pulling up the CBFC over the grant of certification, the court said in its order that the board had failed to adhere to the prescribed guidelines.

Rajpal Yadav promises to meet Gurukul children who sent him their pocket money Rajpal Yadav promised to meet Gurukul students who sent him their pocket savings during his jail term. The actor explained the delay and reacted to their emotional video.

Fans pour in congratulatory wishes as Rashmika Mandanna - Vijay Deverakonda get married Fans flood social media with heartfelt wishes as Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda marry in a traditional Andhra ceremony on February 26 in Udaipur.

Akshay Kumar brings back his comic energy in new Bhooth Bangla song The first song of Bhooth Bangla, featuring Akshay Kumar, has been released, marking the return of the actor-director duo with a comic twist and setting the stage for the film's upcoming April 2026 release.

Konkona Sen Sharma on how Accused avoids default tropes on homosexuality Konkona Sen Sharma said that homosexual characters aren't seen in films unless it is dealt with 'as an issue'. She also opened up on the portrayal of 'differently-abled' characters in cinema.

Hema Malini denies rift rumours with Sunny, Bobby; cites Dharmendra's strong values Hema Malini spoke about the rumours of a rift with Sunny and Bobby Deol, insisting that the family remains united under the values Dharmendra instilled in them. She also opened up about skipping Border 2's screening.

Wear your cake and eat it too: Check out Uorfi Javed's viral style statement Uorfi Javed grabbed attention at a party in a quirky cake dress, even taking a bite of her edible outfit. Watch the viral video of her latest bold fashion statement.

Jyotika praises Thaai Kizhavi for its progressive take on womanhood Jyotika has commended the upcoming Tamil comedy drama Thaai Kizhavi for its portrayal of women and its progressive message, as the film prepares for its theatrical release on February 27.

Why BTS' Jungkook pushing back on smoking criticism is more than a viral moment Jungkook opened up about quitting smoking and addressed criticism during his recent livestream. He also defended BigHit Music and shared excitement about BTS's upcoming ARIRANG album.

Priyanka Chopra recalls Malti's premature birth, how Mahamrityunjay mantra helped Priyanka Chopra Jonas opened up about her experience after the premature birth of her daughter, Malti. She spoke about the challenges of her daughter's extended stay in the NICU and the pressure to make the news public.

K-drama cake, Gangnam Style, Antakshari: Inside Virosh's pre-wedding Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna's pre-wedding celebrations honoured the couple's personal preferences. The couple got married on February 26.

HBO renews thriller series Industry for fifth and final chapter HBO has confirmed that Industry will return for a fifth and final season, bringing an end to the drama series created by Mickey Down and Konrad Kay after a decade-long run.

Rashmika Mandanna, Vijay Deverakonda now married; second ceremony in evening Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda got married in a traditional Andhra wedding ceremony on Thursday morning. The couple will perform another ceremony to honour the bride's family.

general news.headline: Humanity must never become victim of conflict: PM's nod for Gaza plan in IsraelPrime Minister Narendra Modi reiterated on Thursday that the Gaza peace plan opens the road to peace during a joint press conference with Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu in Israel. He added that humanity must never become a victim of conflict.

Not a dry eye left in Israel: Netanyahu on PM Modi's moving Knesset speechPrime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Israel was marked by deep emotional moments and strengthened strategic ties between the two nations.

Meerut man kills wife's lover, then lights beedi before surrendering to copsPolice arrested the accused after the daylight shooting in Meerut. CCTV of the murder and an alleged self-confession video surfaced online, in which he could be seen lighting a beedi before surrendering.

Now, no extra charges for air ticket modifications made within 48 hours of bookingIndia's aviation regulator DGCA updates ticket refund norms, offering flyers a 48-hour free change/cancellation window, faster refunds and clearer rules for name corrections and medical cancellations. Rules aim to fix past refund delays.

How Carney buried the ghost of Trudeau and reset India tiesHandcrafted ByOur Editors Canadian PM Mark Carney, who has styled himself as a champion of middle-power countries, is on a two-day visit to India as he looks to rebuild ties with Delhi. Since he assumed office last year, Carney has taken several steps to bury the ghost of Canada's tumultuous ties with India under Justin Trudeau. Here is how.

IND vs ZIM, Super 8 Live Score: Chennai cricket fans turn up for must-win Super 8 clashIndia (IND) vs Zimbabwe (ZIM), T20 World Cup Super 8 Live Score: A typically batting-friendly Chepauk offers India the perfect platform to reignite their power game and silence the noise after a setback in the Super 8 stage. With the stakes rising and semi-final spots up for grabs, Rohit Sharma's men will look to make a bold statement and reassert their dominance. Zimbabwe, meanwhile, arrive in Chennai searching for answers after a morale-crushing 107-run defeat to West Indies in their Super 8 opener.

Respect judiciary, regret what happened: Education Minister on NCERT textbook rowUnion Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan has responded after the Supreme Court banned the controversial NCERT Class 8 Social Science textbook judiciary chapter and issued contempt notices. Expressing regret, he assured full compliance with the court's directions, promised an inquiry, and said action would be taken against those responsible.

After 70-hr work call, Narayana Murthy has an AI warning for youngsters in IndiaAmid rising fears that AI could disrupt white-collar jobs in India, Infosys founder Narayana Murthy has urged youngsters not to panic. Here is everything he said about this in a recent interview.

Train tickets sold out for Holi, Rs 3,000 bus seat for 30-hour journeyThe Holi rush has peaked across northern India. Flight tickets have breached the Rs 20,000 mark. Amid this, premium services like the Rajdhani and Duronto expresses have long wait lists, and the ones on high-priority sectors have shown REGRET. Even additional Holi special trains announced by the Indian Railways have waiting lists, leaving passengers scrambling for confirmed tickets.

Live: Paper was easy to moderate, map work was scoring, says studentCBSE Board 2026 Class 12 Geography exam LIVE updates: Paper ended at 1:30 pm; the initial reactions to the geography exam reveal that the paper was NCERT-aligned and was student-friendly. The MCQs were tricky but could be managed.

High Court pauses The Kerala Story 2 release, says censors didn't abide by rulesThe Kerala High Court stayed the release of The Kerala Story 2 a day before its scheduled theatrical debut. Pulling up the CBFC over the grant of certification, the court said in its order that the board had failed to adhere to the prescribed guidelines.

World Economic Forum chief Borge Brende quits amid probe into Epstein tiesBorge Brende, President and CEO of the World Economic Forum, has stepped down amid scrutiny over his past interactions with Jeffrey Epstein.

Elephant lifts man, throws him aside during festival in Kerala. Video goes viralAn elephant attacked a man during the Valiyavilakku festival in Kerala by lifting and throwing him aside, leaving him seriously injured. A now-viral video of the incident led to discussions on animal rights.

SA vs WI, Super 8 Live: Markram, De Kock make brisk start to chaseSouth Africa (SA) vs West Indies (WI), T20 World Cup Super 8 Live Score: Aiden Markram and Quinton de Kock have made a brisk start to their run-chase after West Indies recovered to post 176 for eight on the board.

Live: Rashmika Mandanna-Vijay Deverakonda's Kodava wedding beginsRashmika-Vijay Udaipur Wedding Live Updates: The wedding celebrations of Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are underway in Udaipur, with early Instagram glimpses pointing to a celebration that marries charm with refined elegance.

What is a Kodava wedding? Inside Rashmika and Vijay's unique Coorg ceremonyA warrior legacy, back-pleated sarees and blessings over fire rituals, inside the intimate Coorg ceremony that made Rashmika and Vijay's wedding truly unique.
Could the Space Station crash be delayed to 2032?Lawmakers view extending the ISS as part of a broader strategy to counter Beijing's growing footprint and maintain U.S. leadership in orbit.

East India Company goes bankrupt, shuts down again after 170 yearsThe East India Company, once ruler of vast Indian territories, has closed for the second time. Relaunched in the 2000s by Indian entrepreneur Sanjiv Mehta as a Mayfair luxury brand, which sold high-end teas and fine foods. It owed over £950,000 and entered creditors' voluntary liquidation.

IIM Calcutta sees Rs 1.45 crore highest offer, average salary at Rs 36 LPAAt a time when MBA aspirants are closely tracking hiring trends and salary benchmarks, IIM Calcutta's Final Placements 2026 offer a clear snapshot of how India's top B-schools are performing in a shifting job market. With an average package of Rs 36 LPA and the highest domestic offer touching Rs 145 LPA, the results signal sustained demand for premium management talent.

How NCERT chapter on judicial corruption drew Supreme Court wrath and a banA Social Science textbook recently released by NCERT, which carried a section on 'corruption in judiciary', has the Supreme Court seeing red. The court, which described it as a deep-rooted conspiracy, has not only barred the sharing of the content but also banned the book altogether.

Sri Lanka knocked out. What do Pakistan need to qualify for semi-final?T20 World Cup: Sri Lanka were knocked out of the T20 World Cup by New Zealand on Wednesday, February 25. This loss means that Pakistan's chances to qualify for the semi-final are very slim. But what is the exact equation?

IND vs ZIM preview: At generous Chepauk, wounded India look to revive power gameIndia vs Zimbabwe, T20 World Cup Super 8 preview: A batting-friendly Chepauk offers wounded India the ideal stage to revive their power game and make a statement. Zimbabwe, meanwhile, look to regroup after a morale-crushing 107-run defeat to West Indies in their Super 8 opener.

YouTuber found dead in Hyderabad flat; scared to move on, she wrote on breakupPreliminary inquiry suggested that 21-year-old Bonu Komali, a YouTuber as well as a college student, had been in severe emotional distress in recent months. She had sent a message, expressing affection, to her mother before being found dead at her Hyderabad flat.

US court OKs Tesla lawsuit for hiring H-1B visa workers while sacking AmericansA court in the US said Tesla will have to face a lawsuit for allegedly favouring H-1B visa-holding foreign workers over American citizens. A software engineer claimed that the EV-maker hired over 1,300 workers on H-1B visas while sacking 6,000 employees, mostly Americans.

sports.headline: New Zealand coach wary of Harry Brook threat before must-win clash vs England T20 World Cup, ENG vs NZ: Head coach Rob Walter said New Zealand are well aware of the threat Harry Brook poses as the Kiwis face England on Friday in Colombo. On Tuesday, Brook's century propelled England into the semifinals with a two-wicket win over Pakistan.

IND vs ZIM, Super 8 Live Score: India meet Zimbabwe with semis hopes on the line India (IND) vs Zimbabwe (ZIM), T20 World Cup Super 8 Live Score: A typically batting-friendly Chepauk offers India the perfect platform to reignite their power game and silence the noise after a setback in the Super 8 stage. With the stakes rising and semi-final spots up for grabs, Rohit Sharma's men will look to make a bold statement and reassert their dominance. Zimbabwe, meanwhile, arrive in Chennai searching for answers after a morale-crushing 107-run defeat to West Indies in their Super 8 opener.

RCB, RR get new suitor as US tycoon enters bidding race for IPL franchise David Blitzer's interest has intensified the battle for stakes in RCB and Rajasthan Royals. With global investors now circling IPL franchises, the league's financial pull continues to grow beyond traditional cricket markets.

Ronaldo becomes part-owner, buys 25 percent stake in Spanish 2nd-tier side Cristiano Ronaldo has become a part-owner of the Spanish second-tier side Almeria as he enters the world of football management. Almeria is battling to return to the LaLiga next season.

KKR's Umran Malik concedes 36 in an over, 59 in two in DY Patil T20 Cup spell Kolkata Knight Riders pacer Umran Malik endured a nightmare outing in the DY Patil T20 Cup, conceding 59 runs in just two overs while representing Tata Sports Club against Mumbai Customs on February 25.

Would have given Abhishek Sharma a break: Sehwag's bold call before IND vs ZIM T20 World Cup: Former opener Virender Sehwag has called for Abhishek Sharma to be rested ahead of India's crucial Super 8 encounter with Zimbabwe. Sehwag said India should pick players based on form for the must-win match.

SA vs WI, Super 8 Live: Markram, De Kock make brisk start to chase South Africa (SA) vs West Indies (WI), T20 World Cup Super 8 Live Score: Aiden Markram and Quinton de Kock have made a brisk start to their run-chase after West Indies recovered to post 176 for eight on the board.

Left, right, left? Why India should turn to Sanju Samson to get starts right India vs Zimbabwe, T20 World Cup Super 8: With India's opening stands stalling and part-timers reaping rewards, their campaign needs an urgent fix at the top. Is reintroducing Sanju Samson the tactical recalibration needed to find the right balance?

SL vs NZ: Sangakkara demands urgent reforms after Sri Lanka's T20 World Cup exit T20 World Cup: Kumar Sangakkara called for urgent reform on all levels after Sri Lanka's early T20 World Cup exit. He warned that unless Sri Lanka adapt to the modern game quickly, the gap between them and leading teams will only continue to grow.

T20 World Cup: No dew drama in IND vs ZIM? US chemical to be used at Chepauk T20 World Cup: Dew may not play factor during the India vs Zimbabwe clash at Chepauk on Thursday, with the Tamil Nadu Cricket Association using a US-imported chemical to tackle with the moisture during the game.

Vinicuis gets his revenge as Real Madrid knock Benfica out of Champions League Vinicius Jr sealed Real Madrid's 3-1 win with a decisive late goal against Benfica. Days after off-field controversy, the Brazilian shifted the focus back to football and guided Madrid into the Champions League Round of 16.

Jammu and Kashmir captain Paras Dogra fined for headbutt row in Ranji Trophy finalRanji Trophy Final: Paras Dogra is set to be fined after his on-field clash with KV Aneesh during the Ranji Trophy final. The flashpoint briefly sparked chaos but did little to stop Jammu and Kashmir's march to 584.

Dube's bowling questioned, called a batter and not an all-rounder by ex-IND starT20 World Cup: Mohammed Kaif isn't convinced with Shivam Dube's capabilities as a bowler, saying that he is a batter and not an all-rounder. Dube has been expensive with the ball this year for India.

Dasun Shanaka apologises to fans as Sri Lanka crash out of T20 World CupT20 World Cup: After crashing out of the T20 World Cup 2026, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka issued an apology to fans, saying that they failed to provide a win to make them happy during the tournament.

The Abhishek Sharma slump: What's gone wrong and how he can fix itT20 World Cup: Abhishek Sharma was in the form of his life going into the T20 World Cup. What's gone wrong? India Today delves into the left-hander's problems and how to fix those ahead of the team's do-or-die clash against Zimbabwe.

Beating Sri Lanka at home is a big achievement for New Zealand: Rachin RavindraT20 World Cup: New Zealand all-rounder Rachin Ravindra said their win over Sri Lanka was a big achievement, especially on Sri Lankan soil. With the victory over the co-hosts, New Zealand are now in a strong position to secure a semi-final spot.

Chennai metro steps up for IND vs ZIM: Free tickets for fans to ChepaukChennai Metro Rail Limited will provide complimentary metro rides on Thursday, February 26, for those attending the India vs Zimbabwe Super 8 match, with match tickets doubling as metro passes. The initiative includes extended services to midnight and special operational measures near the Chepauk stadium.

Sri Lanka job done, but New Zealand cannot underestimate England: Rachin RavindraT20 World Cup: Rachin Ravindra said New Zealand cannot afford to take England lightly despite beating Sri Lanka. With a semi-final spot at stake, their final Super 8 clash will decide how far this campaign goes.

Shanaka blames negativity, seeks government help after Sri Lanka's World Cup exitT20 World Cup: Dasun Shanaka blamed growing negativity and tough conditions after Sri Lanka's T20 World Cup exit, urging government support to protect future players as the 2014 champions crashed out following a heavy defeat at Khettarama.

IND vs ZIM preview: At generous Chepauk, wounded India look to revive power gameIndia vs Zimbabwe, T20 World Cup Super 8 preview: A batting-friendly Chepauk offers wounded India the ideal stage to revive their power game and make a statement. Zimbabwe, meanwhile, look to regroup after a morale-crushing 107-run defeat to West Indies in their Super 8 opener.

India keep close watch as South Africa, West Indies aim for semis spotsSouth Africa and West Indies face off in a crucial Super 8 match at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. The winner will take a big step towards the T20 World Cup 2026 semi-finals, with net run rate playing a key role.

South Africa wary of explosive West Indies threat in Super 8: Keshav MaharajT20 World Cup 2026, SA vs WI: Keshav Maharaj, speaking to the reporters before the Super 8 clash on Thursday in Ahmedabad, said that South Africa are wary of the threat West Indies pose.

West Indies have flown under the radar, but have nothing to prove: Floyd ReiferT20 World Cup, SA vs WI: Speaking to the reporters before their Super 8 clash against South Africa in Ahmedabad, West Indies batting coach Floyd Reifer said that the team hasn't got enough attention of late, but they don't have any point to prove.

Smriti Mandhana, Jemimah Rodrigues in Women's Bangladesh Premier League? BCB opens upThe BCB has stated that Indian cricketers are welcome to participate in the inaugural edition of the Women's Bangladesh Premier League. At present, the Indian players are in Australia, competing in a multi-format series against the hosts.

India have got home advantage, but pressure does funny things to teams: Ryan BurlT20 World Cup 2026, IND vs ZIM: Speaking to the reporters, all-rounder Ryan Burl said that both India and Zimbabwe will be under pressure going into their Super 8 clash on Thursday at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai.

Sri Lanka knocked out. What do Pakistan need to qualify for semi-final?T20 World Cup: Sri Lanka were knocked out of the T20 World Cup by New Zealand on Wednesday, February 25. This loss means that Pakistan's chances to qualify for the semi-final are very slim. But what is the exact equation?

New Zealand knock Sri Lanka out of T20 World Cup, Pakistan in huge trouble as wellT20 World Cup, NZ vs SL: Mitchell Santner's New Zealand knocked Sri Lanka out of the competition with a dominating 61-run win on Wednesday at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo. Rachin Ravindra was the star for the Black Caps with four wickets.

Samson in, Tilak out? In do-or-die clash, India consider big changesIndia vs Zimbabwe: The Indian team are likely to make important changes in their playing XI in their do-or-die clash against Zimbabwe. Sanju Samson is likely to get a look-in.

Amelia Kerr makes dream start to New Zealand captaincy era with special all-round showNZW vs ZIMW, 1st T20I: Amelia Kerr delivered a stunning all-round performance on Wednesday, smashing a 51-ball century and returning figures of 4-0-14-2 as New Zealand defeated Zimbabwe by 92 runs at Seddon Park in Hamilton.

T20 World Cup: Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza 100 per cent fit for must-win India clashZimbabwe leg-spinner Ryan Burl brushed aside any fitness concerns around captain Sikandar Raza, confirming that the talismanic all-rounder is "100 per cent" fit for their must-win Super 8 clash against India in the T20 World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
